channel.title: Slack on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Slack on Memo Tut

item.title: [Natural language processing] I tried to visualize the comments of each member in the Slack community
item.description: ## About this article In this article, I will introduce a method to visualize what each member says in the Slack community with Wordcloud. The source code can be found here [https://github.com/sota0121/slack-msg-analysis) :octocat: I would also like to read: [Natural language processing] I tried to visualize the topics raised this week in the Slack community table of contents Usage and output example Get message from Slack Pre-processing: table creation/cleaning/morphological analysis/normalization/stopword removal Pre-processing: Extracting important words (tf-idf) Visualization processing with Wordcloud Bonus *I would like to summarize the preprocessing in another article in the future

item.title: [Natural language processing] I tried to visualize the topics raised this week in the Slack community
item.description: ## About this article In this article, I will introduce a method of using Wordcloud to visualize what topics were raised within a certain period (here one week) of the Slack community. The source code can be found here [https://github.com/sota0121/slack-msg-analysis) :octocat: I would also like to read: [Natural language processing] I tried to visualize the comments of each member in the Slack community table of contents Usage and output example Get message from Slack Pre-processing: message mart table creation Pre-treatment: Cleaning Pre-processing: Morphological analysis (Janome) Pre-processing: Normalization Pre-processing: Stop word removal Pre-processing: Extract important words (tf-idf) Visualization processing with Wordcloud Bonus *I would like to summarize the preprocessing in another article in the future

item.title: COVID-19 Hokkaido data ③ Full automation (validation/error detection)
item.description: ## Table of contents COVID-19 Hokkaido data edition (1) Initial data creation by scraping etc. COVID-19 Hokkaido Data Edition (2) To Open Data + Automatic Update COVID-19 Hokkaido data ③ Fully automated ←This article! Towards full automation Current status GitHub Actions has already automated the reading of original data and the generation of json files GitHub Pages implements hosting of automatically generated json files Task Although the original data is open data, the file is created manually by the person in charge of each local government, so it is necessary to validate the input value.

item.title: Let Siri do the job of reading AWS bills posted by Slackbot
item.description: #Introduction I’ve been using the iPhone for less than a decade and I noticed that Siri wasn’t working at all. Now that smart speakers are popular, I want my Siri to do more, so I decided to read the AWS bill posted by Slackbot. From the results, it looks like this. When you ask for the price… He read the content I posted to Slack. Then, I will introduce various ways to make it.

item.title: I tried to make a document search slack command using Kendra announced at re:Invent 2019
item.description: Hello, this is the eighth day of [ABEJA Advent Calendar](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/abeja). Introduction An interesting service was announced at re:Invent 2019 the other day. Yes, enterprise search service Amazon Kendra release. There are various communication tools in the company. However, all of them tend to be flow information and are not well organized, and the problem that information disparities are likely to occur is emerging. This is exactly Kendra’s task. When announced, this has no choice but to try!

item.title: Employee 2vec: Extract member characteristics from Slack history and visualize organizational structure
item.description: It is the 7th day of [ABEJA Advent Calendar](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/abeja). #Introduction Last time, I dropped a piece of information that couldn’t make a VIP channel in Slack, but it’s not good to think that ABEJA is just playing with VIP, so I decided to send it to Tech a little this time. In this article, I’ll try the following two stories. If it’s hard to understand, maybe you can jump to the bottom and see the graph.

item.title: A story of making an anonymous channel with Slack from zero knowledge
item.description: #Introduction A memorandum when I struggled to create an anonymous channel on Slack without any knowledge of AWS, Lambda, or Python. #Trigger When I was thinking that I had to write something on Qiita after being invited by the Advent Calendar Talk about creating a VIP channel for in-house slack https://qiita.com/peisuke/items/80984db8b47cd8243019 After reading this article, this looks interesting! I would like to introduce it to Slack where I participate!

item.title: A story of trial and error trying to create a dynamic user group in Slack
item.description: This article is a December 6th article of [JSL \ (Japan System Giken \) Advent Calendar 2019 \- Qiita](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2019/jsl).Lastyear'scalendaris[here!!](https://qiita.com/advent-calendar/2018/jsl) TL;DR It seems useful to have dynamic user groups in Slack like @here Is it possible to use Slack’s usergroups.users.update API? It was possible after periodic execution using Chalice (Python) and AWS Lambda I was able to do it, but I quit because there was a problem Is it suitable for the purpose?

item.title: Acquire information from the Japan Meteorological Agency and notify Slack of weather alerts for the 23 wards of Tokyo
item.description: Domo, good evening! This is the 5th day article of Zapier Advent Calendar 2019. This time, Want to detect the weather warning of 23 wards as soon as possible! I would like to refer to more probable information instead of the third party API! I made a little Zap, so I will introduce it. I’m streaming this into Slack :point_down: Overview of Zap We use the data provided by the Japan Meteorological Agency to obtain weather information, and send it to Slack by filtering and parsing it in Python.
